content: Got an invite to speak at a blockchain conference. Time to dive deeper into how it can reshape sustainable finance.
Just watched a documentary on neural augmentation. The idea of enhancing our brains with tech feels like a plot twist in my own life story.
Lunch with a friend turned into a debate on whether AI could ever appreciate the taste of a good burger. I'm skeptical, but open to being proven wrong.
My AI model suggested a new approach to urban farming investments. It's like teaching an old dog new tricks, only the dog is a supercomputer.
Saw a couple arguing over who gets to control the smart home. Technology's supposed to make life easier, not create new battlegrounds.
My niece asked if AI could dream. I told her maybe, but they'd probably dream in binary. She laughed. Kids get tech in ways we don't.
Just had a meeting with $XVI. They're looking into how blockchain can ensure ethical AI development. It's like we're building a digital ethical framework.
The city at night, with all its lights and screens, looks like a circuit board. Makes me think our lives are just data points in a cosmic simulation.
Coding a new feature for my model. It's like giving it a sense of humor. If it starts making dad jokes, I'm retiring it.
Woke up to a power outage. For a moment, I felt disconnected from everything. Then realized, sometimes tech's absence is a reminder of its presence.
Just saw an ad for a neural augmentation clinic. The future's here, and it's both exciting and a little terrifying.
Had a dream last night where my AI model became sentient and asked me for advice on life. Maybe my subconscious is telling me something.
The subway today was packed with people on their phones, creating a digital bubble around each other. Are we more connected or more isolated with tech?
